headline.main: Santorum Collects $600,000 for Second Presidential Campaign
headline.print_headline: Santorum Collects $600,000 for Second Presidential Campaign

docs.snippet: Rick Santorum, who came in second place in the 2012 Republican presidential nominating contest, has raised about $607,000 for his new bid....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rick Santorum, who came in second place in the 2012 Republican presidential nominating contest, has raised about $607,000 for his new bid.

headline.main: Philippines to Station Warplanes, Frigates at Former U.S. Base Facing Disputed Sea
headline.print_headline: Philippines to Station Warplanes, Frigates at Former U.S. Base Facing Disputed Sea

docs.snippet: The Philippines will station new fighter jets and two frigates at the former U.S. naval facility in Subic Bay from early next year, officials said, the first time the massive installation has functioned as a military base in 23 years....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Philippines will station new fighter jets and two frigates at the former U.S. naval facility in Subic Bay from early next year, officials said, the first time the massive installation has functioned as a military base in 23 years.

docs.snippet: In a story July 15 about Netflix's rapid subscriber growth, The Associated Press reported erroneously that the company executed a seven-for-one stock split last week. The first day of post-split trading of Netflix's stock occurred Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story July 15 about Netflix's rapid subscriber growth, The Associated Press reported erroneously that the company executed a seven-for-one stock split last week. The first day of post-split trading of Netflix's stock occurred Wednesday.

headline.main: Putin, Obama Agree Iran Deal in World's Interests, Kremlin Says
headline.print_headline: Putin, Obama Agree Iran Deal in World's Interests, Kremlin Says

docs.snippet: Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Barack Obama discussed by telephone on Wednesday the nuclear deal between Iran and six world powers and agreed it was in the interests of the world as a whole, the Kremlin said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Barack Obama discussed by telephone on Wednesday the nuclear deal between Iran and six world powers and agreed it was in the interests of the world as a whole, the Kremlin said.

headline.main: African-Americans Still Favor Gun Control, but Views Are Shifting
headline.print_headline: African-Americans Still Favor Gun Control, but Views Are Shifting

docs.snippet: Horace Augustine was raised in Oklahoma City by a mother with strong convictions about guns: She didn’t want them in her house. Faith, she insisted, would keep her family safe....
docs.lead_paragraph: Horace Augustine was raised in Oklahoma City by a mother with strong convictions about guns: She didn’t want them in her house. Faith, she insisted, would keep her family safe.

headline.main: For the Costellos, a Gentle Chaos

docs.snippet: The family abandoned the frenzy of New York City for a slower pace. But life in a storied pink house in the Garden District of New Orleans is its own kind of crazy....
docs.abstract: The family abandoned the frenzy of New York City for a slower pace. But life in a storied pink house in the Garden District of New Orleans is its own kind of crazy.

headline.main: Sara Errani Through to Quarterfinals in Bucharest
headline.print_headline: Sara Errani Through to Quarterfinals in Bucharest

docs.snippet: Top-seeded Sara Errani overcame a slow start to beat Shahar Peer 7-6 (5), 6-2 on Wednesday and reach the quarterfinals of the Bucharest Open....
docs.lead_paragraph: Top-seeded Sara Errani overcame a slow start to beat Shahar Peer 7-6 (5), 6-2 on Wednesday and reach the quarterfinals of the Bucharest Open.

docs.snippet: New videos posted to social media websites show fierce battles raging in the historic city of Aleppo, as well as the coastal city of Latakia. Diane Hodges reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: New videos posted to social media websites show fierce battles raging in the historic city of Aleppo, as well as the coastal city of Latakia. Diane Hodges reports.
